net.kuujo.vertigo.network

Interface NetworkContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Context<NetworkContext>, net.kuujo.vertigo.util.serialization.JsonSerializable, net.kuujo.vertigo.util.Observable<NetworkContext>

    public interface NetworkContext
extends Context<NetworkContext>
    A network context which contains information regarding the complete structure of a deployed network.

    Network contexts are immutable as they are constructed after a network is deployed.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name()
        Returns the network name.

        The network name is unique to the network within a Vertigo cluster.

        Returns:
        The network name.

      • version

        String version()
        Returns the network version. Contexts may be updated through network configuration changes, so the version can be used to track updates to the network.
        Returns:
        The network version.

      • config

        NetworkConfig config()
        Returns the network configuration from which the context was built.
        Returns:
        The network configuration.

      • status

        String status()
        Returns the network status address.

        This is the address of a shared-data key that is monitored by all component instances in the cluster. When the key is set, components know that the network is considered stable. During a network configuration change, the network manager will unset the status address, notifying components that the network is no longer stable until the key is reset. This is the mechanism used by Vertigo to perform coordination between components.

        Returns:
        The network status address.

      • components

        List<ComponentContext<?>> components()
        Returns a list of network component contexts.
        Returns:
        A list of network component contexts.

      • hasComponent

        boolean hasComponent(String name)
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the component exists.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the component to check.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether a component with that name exists.

      • component

        <T extends ComponentContext<?>> T component(String name)
        Returns a component context by name.
        Parameters:
        name - The component name.
        Returns:
        A component context.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If a component does not exist at the given name.
